nomenclature.name: Calamus palustris
nomenclature.author: Griff.
nomenclature.bibref: Beccari in Hook, f., Fl. Brit. Ind. 6: 1893
Beccari, Ann. Roy. Bot. Gard. Calcutta 11: 401., PI. 173, 1908
Basu, Rattans in India Monogr. Rev.: 63. 1992

div.p: Solitary, medium diameter rattan. Stem to 20 m long or more, with sheaths 2.5 cm in diameter, without sheaths 1.5 cm. Leaf 2.5-2.9 m long, citrate; sheath pale green, with horizontal green markings, spiny: spines broad-based, flat, deflexed, 2.5 cm long, arranged irregularly with smaller ones; knee prominent; ocrea slightly developed; petiole very short in mature leaves, 8-10 cm long, spiny; rachis spiny on the upper side and margins, basal portion of adaxial side with a single row of spines, distal portion with half whorls of recurved black spines: leaflets 30-46 x 3.5-6.1 cm, grouped, lanceolate, midrib not prominent, margin ciliate. Inflorescence long flagellate; male inflorescence 1.5 m long; primary sheath tubular, enlarged distally, loosely sheathing; partial inflorescence to 50 cm long; secondary sheath closely sheathing, rachilla 2.5 cm long, male flowers 4 mm long; female inflorescence, primary sheath tightly sheathing, armed with spines; spines recurved, 0.6 cm long; partial inflorescence 50 cm long; secondary sheath tightly sheathing, spiny, spines 0.2 cm long; rachilla 8-10 cm long; female flowers 4 mm long; involucre cup-shaped. Fruit ovoid, 1.5 x 1 cm long; scales in 19 vertical rows, dirty straw coloured, superficially channelled in the middle; endosperm not ruminate.
In evergreen forests of South and Little Andamans. (Map. 6).
Used in furniture industry and also used for making walking sticks and 'lathies'.

Bajajag Valley. Jan. 1897, Heining s.n. (CAL) Ace. no.595167; Navy Point, Jarwakhari hill jungle. 7.4.1894, Kurz s.n. (CAL); Wumberleygung, South Andamans, 6.4.88, male fl., Renuca 4059 (KFRI); 4th KM, Little Andamans, 13.4.92, Vijayakumaran 6636(KFRI); Mannarghat, South Andamans, 1.4.1993, male infl., Renuka and Vijayakumaran 7030 (KFRI).
